page.title: 14Tourism-Beamish
page.content:
{Rowley Station
An 1867 passenger station from Rowley,near Consett in County Durham, has been reconstructed to form the centre-piece of a North Eastern railway station.It is complete with footbridges,signal box (working), goods shed,weigh cabin and coal cells.Passengers can ride on board a vintage train for a short nostalgic journey back to the great days of steam. Near to the Drift mine is a working replica of 'Locomotion' one of the original steam locomotives to run on the Stockton to Darlington Railway. On almost half a mile of track a 1925 Gateshead electric tram operates.
